conclusion: Analyze speed-time graphs to determine stopping distances and collision possibility.
Graph a shows the car starting at 30 m/s and decelerating; graph b shows the truck at a constant 10 m/s.
The car and the truck are initially 30 meters apart.
Car's speed-time graph shows it decelerates from 30 m/s; slope indicates deceleration rate.
Truck's speed-time graph shows a constant speed of 10 m/s; truck does not stop.
Calculate stopping distances: car's stopping distance based on time to stop; truck's stopping distance is zero.
Since the truck doesn't stop and the car's stopping distance is more than 30 meters, they will collide.
Yes. The car and the truck will collide.
